intro: Calia, commonly known as the "dove's foot" or "calia flower," is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves that resemble the foot of a dove, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Calia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a decorative plant in containers.
